author: husted
msg: Move sections 4.6.2 through 4.7.4.2 and 4.8 to a new chapter ("Configuring Applications") to be uploaded later.
Add references to new chapter, but no content changes.

author: husted
msg: Proof-reading / formatting / spell-check pass. No significant content changes.
Most of the changes are line-wraps from applying the coding rules to our XML:
* Line wraps at column 78.
* Sentences ("statements") begin a new line.
Starting a new line at each sentence minimizes future changes, since the rest of the paragraph does not need to be re-wrapped.
It also helps highlight longer sentences (a readability issue).
Other conventions:
* For paragraph and paragraph-like elements (UL, LI, TD), the element is placed above and below the text to increase legibility.
* Single space between paragraph-like elements, unless there is only one element in the block.
I apologize if this annoys anyone, but the XML formatting is getting out of control
and it's sometimes difficult to make routine changes.
I didn't use a specific tool to do this,but just applied the rules during an overall review of the documentation.
